oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Dan Seals Interview - Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Dan Seals (performer) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Dan Seals; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Dan Seals talks about moving from West Texas and falling in love with Same Cooke and Jackie Wilson during his developmental years -- (00:42) Seals talks about his father's style of guitar playing and how he would play with Ernest Tubb -- (01:32) Seals talks about visiting Tubb's store -- (02:12) "Made for Loving You" is discussed by Biff Collie and Seals; Seals talks about visiting Big Tree Records to discover "Made for Loving You" and the vocals associated with it -- (02:57) Collie and Seals talk about the Seals family's unusual musical inclination -- (03:50) Seals and Collie talk about his brother, Jim, being a world class fiddle player at nine and Seals joining the family band -- (05:03) Collie and Seals joke about how Seals discovered a six string bass fiddle -- (5:57) "She Flew the Coupe" is discussed as a "Louisiana bayou" song that uplifts people -- (07:05) Seals tells how the most difficult song to find is an upbeat-tempo song -- (07:30) Collie and Seals talk about Jim Seals' position in the Champs (musical group) -- (08:48) Seals reflects on how his family fostered his musical confidence -- (10:34) "Wood" is reflected on Seals' effort in creating a bamboo rod -- (12:54) Seals tells of how memory is influenced by music -- (13:38) Seals tells a story about an old man giving up the fiddle -- (14:23) "Bordertown" is described as a ranger who goes against everything he ever believed in -- (15:30) John Porter McMeans is discussed by Seals as an exceptional writer and discusses their process with "Water Under the Bridge" -- (16:47) Seals' frequency of album releases is discussed as proportional to his ability to find songs -- (17:34) Collie and Seals talk about Seals sending a demo tape to Atlantic Records and that demo being over-heard by a member of Big Tree Records -- (19:11) Seals' nickname 'England Dan' is visited -- (19:46) Seals talks about his Chevy and writing while driving -- (20:48) Seals tells of how he purchased his first vehicle -- (22:20) "A Heart in Search of Love" is told as a reflection of Seals' view of people at his concerts -- (23:10) Collie and Seals talk about how Seals got his name -- (23:33) Seals tells of a time where he had performed with both of his brothers for the first time -- (24:28) Seals tells of how people react to Troy Seals' music -- (25:28) Seals tells of his family's heritage and when his family lived in Tennessee -- (26:23) Seals tells of his experience of writing "Lonestar" with J. D. Salinger -- (27:27) Seals speaks on writing an open-ending type song -- (28:16) Seals tells of how he had been met with lawsuits in Nashville and his attempt to rebuild -- (30:32) Collie and Seals talk about "Game of Love" and how the song's message pulled Seals -- (31:22) Seals and Collie talk about Seals' potential to be a disc jockey and Seals says goodbye
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Seals, Dan; Collie, Biff;
